title: Meta Secretly Trained Its AI on a Notorious Piracy Database, Newly Unredacted Court Docs Reveal - 'Wired' News Summary (United States) | BEAMSTART
text:
Quick Summary: One of the most important AI copyright legal battles just took a major turn.
These newly unredacted documents reveal exchanges between Meta employees unearthed in the discovery process, like a Meta engineer telling a colleague that they hesitated to access LibGen data because â€œtorrenting from a [Meta-owned] corporate laptop doesnâ€™t feel right ðŸ˜ƒâ€.
In November 2023, Chhabria granted Metaâ€™s motion to dismiss some of the lawsuitâ€™s claims, including its claim Metaâ€™s alleged use of the authorsâ€™ work to train AI violated the Digital Millennium Copyright Act, a US law introduced in 1998 to stop people from selling or duplicating copyrighted works on the internet.
